metadata.title: CVE-2021-38300 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-updates 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
arch/mips/net/bpf_jit.c in the Linux kernel before 5.4.10 can generateundesirable machine code when transforming unprivileged cBPF programs,allowing execution of arbitrary code within the kernel context. This occursbecause conditional branches can exceed the 128 KB limit of the MIPSarchitecture.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-38300` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-1075-fips - 4.15.0-1075.84
linux-image-hmac-4.15.0-1075-fips - 4.15.0-1075.84
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1075-fips - 4.15.0-1075.84
linux-image-unsigned-hmac-4.15.0-1075-fips - 4.15.0-1075.84
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1010-ibm - 5.4.0-1010.11~18.04.2
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-2059-aws-fips - 4.15.0-2059.61
linux-image-unsigned-hmac-4.15.0-2059-aws-fips - 4.15.0-2059.61
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-2041-azure-fips - 4.15.0-2041.45
linux-image-unsigned-hmac-4.15.0-2041-azure-fips - 4.15.0-2041.45
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-2024-gcp-fips - 4.15.0-2024.26
linux-image-unsigned-hmac-4.15.0-2024-gcp-fips - 4.15.0-2024.26
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro
